Ciena is committed to our people-first philosophy. Our teams enjoy a culture focused on prioritizing a personalized and flexible work environment that empowers an individual’s passions, growth, wellbeing and belonging. We’re a technology company that leads with our humanity—driving our business priorities alongside meaningful social, community, and societal impact. 
 
 How You Will Contribute:
 
  Requirements for telecommunications networks are constantly evolving, and our products also need to advance and scale to meet the needs of our customers while also delivering uniform and consistent user experiences.
 
  As a Waveserver Lab Technician you will be hands on with our next generation optical network solutions in a dynamic team environment. You will work alongside experienced professionals to ensure the reliability and performance of projects that play critical roles in our network solutions and help build upon our innovative technology. You will also challenge yourself and others by bringing enthusiasm and fresh ideas to new challenges and leading by example.
 
 
   You will be responsible for the installation, maintenance, and troubleshooting of optical network solutions
   You will use a detail-oriented approach to service user tickets, maintain records of equipment and track new hardware orders and requests
   You will assist in maintaining hardware and setups including cable management, labeling, and organization
   You will be accountable for managing individual project priorities, assignments, and timelines.
   You will participate in the full software development lifecycle, collaborating with multi-functional teams of developers, UX designers, quality assurance teams & release managers.
 
 
  What Does Ciena Expect of You?
 
   Initiative – You are a self-starter who works with limited direction and is committed to delivering against aggressive deadlines.
   Agility – you are readily able to make key decisions and manage competing and ever-changing account priorities.
 
 
   Communication expertise – the ability to influence and tailor your message and ideas to the audience to ensure understanding and buy in.
   An ability to go ‘up and down the ladder’ – capable of seeing the big picture, but also understanding the importance of the details and analysis.
   The flexibility to work independently and as part of a broader team – you thrive in a multi-disciplinary team environment, but are comfortable working independently as required.
   Relationship builder – with an innate ability to influence, you can quickly develop trusted connections and get work done across multi sites.
   A commitment to innovation – you keep abreast of the market and competitive developments and are always keen to formulate new ideas and problem solve.
 
 
  The Must Haves:
 
   College diploma in physical technology, electronics, or equivalent
   Experience working with optical networking equipment
   Knowledge of networking protocols such as TCP/IP, DNS, and DHCP
   Strong organization skills and attention to detail
   Must be in Ottawa or willing to relocate as this position is in person five days a week
 
 
  Why Ciena:
 
   We believe an inclusive, diverse, and barrier-free work environment makes for empowered and committed employees.
   We recognize the importance of well-being and offer programs and benefits to support and sustain the mental and physical health of our employees and their families and provide a variety of paid family leave programs.
   We are committed to employee development, offering tuition reimbursement, in-house learning, and mentorship opportunities.
   We know that financial security is important. We offer competitive salaries and incentive programs, RSU’s (job level specific) and an employee share option purchase program.
   We realize time away to recharge is non-negotiable. We offer unlimited paid time off!
   Great work deserves recognition. We have a robust recognition program, with ongoing and enhanced awards for exemplary performance.
 
 
  At Ciena, we are committed to building and fostering an environment in which our employees feel respected, valued, and heard. Ciena values the diversity of its workforce and respects its employees as individuals. We do not tolerate any form of discrimination.
 
  If contacted in relation to a job opportunity, please advise Ciena of any accommodation measures you may require.

Start date 
    As soon as possible. 
    Purpose of position 
    Provide laboratory assistance in the daily operations of the Cardiac P.E.T. Radiochemistry laboratory by : 
    
    Assisting with the daily production of radiopharmaceuticals using specialized radio-chemistry laboratory equipment. 
    Analysing all radiopharmaceuticals and maintain results (documentation) produced by the radio-chemistry laboratory. 
   
   Responsibilities 
   
    Daily production of radiopharmaceuticals. 
    Carry out the functions in the production of radiopharmaceuticals by preparing solutions, properly identifying, labeling, packaging for transportation. 
    Monitor production of radiopharmaceuticals, recognize problems and initiate established corrective protocols. 
    Run the cyclotron for producing radiopharmaceutical. 
    Work with the radio-chemists in developing technical protocols. 
    Quality control procedures, analysis, report all deficiencies, create and maintain current database per isotope and detector for the cyclotron. 
    Participate in research projects as directed. 
    Assist in the implementation of new techniques and protocols. 
   
   Requirements 
   
    BSc Chemistry or equivalent 
    2 years experience in a progressive chemical laboratory 
    Working experience with radioactive materials is considered an asset 
   
   Preferred qualifications 
    Knowledge of: 
    
    General laboratory equipment (HPLC, thin-layer chromatography, osmometer, gas chromatograph, radioactivity detectors) and their applications along with standard procedures. 
    Procedure instrumentation. 
    Legislated requirements related to practice and equipment operation relevant to job function. 
    Ability to troubleshoot to component level. 
   
   To apply 
    To apply, please send your cover letter and CV to jobpostings@ottawaheart.ca. 
    Applications from Indigenous persons, members of racialized minorities, persons with disabilities, women, members of the LGBTQ+ community, as well as from all qualified candidates with the skills and knowledge to productively engage with equitable, diverse and inclusive communities are strongly encouraged. 
    According to government policy, all qualified candidates are invited to apply; however, preference will be given to Canadians and permanent residents. When submitting your application, please indicate if you are legally entitled to work in Canada. 
    The University of Ottawa Heart Institute is committed to ensuring barrier-free selection processes and work environments. Accommodations will be provided in all parts of the hiring process relating to any specialty requirements. Please notify us of any accommodations that you require – any information you provide will be handled respectfully and in complete confidence. 
    The successful candidate will be required, prior to the start of employment, to complete mandatory organizational training available online, and provide the following: an official piece of photo identification and a satisfactory Criminal Record Check and proof of two doses of COVID-19 vaccine.

positionName: Dental Technician - Case Consultant & Quality Control
description:
Dental Technician - Case Consultant & Quality Control 
  (Français version suit)
 
  ABOUT MILIDENT 
  Opened in June 1995, Milident Inc specializes in the creation of complex cases, implant-supported crown and bridge, fixed and removable dentures as well as orthodontic appliances. Always at the forefront of technology, Milident Inc. continues to offer its products and services tailored to the specific needs of its clientele. Through its internal research and development program, Milident Inc. is continually exploring new technological advances in manufacturing its high-precision dental prosthesis.
  
  
 Description: 
  The Case Consultant is responsible for client communication with regards to case support and treatment planning, while maintaining a high level of customer satisfaction. This position will also be responsible for managing final quality control and providing internal team training around technical aspects of all cases.
  
  
 If you have at least 5 years’ experience in the dental lab industry, together with strong supervisory skills, we want to hear from you! A relocation package will be available.
  
  
  General Responsibilities:
 
  Case Consultant 
  
  Assess, identify, and offer solutions for problem restorative cases 
  Discuss restorative options with doctors via phone/email 
  Ensure proper instructions are given to the technicians regarding problem cases 
  
 
 Final Quality Control 
  
  Ensure final restoration and appliances meet the company quality control standards
 
  
  
  Qualifications:
  
  
  
  Technical School – Certification as a Registered Dental Technician or equivalent education and experience 
  5 years of experience in dental lab industry 
  Must be able to manage people, processes, and technology 
  Must possess effective English and French communication skills (both oral and written,) while offering strong interpersonal skills 
  Excellent time management skills; acts skillfully with a sense of urgency 
  High attention to detail and accuracy 
  Ability to think strategically and to lead 
  Advanced troubleshooting and multi-tasking experience 
  Awareness of relevant industry technology trends and applications
 
  
  
 Technicien dentaire - Consultant cas et contrôle de la qualité
 
  À PROPOS DE NOUS 
  Fondée en juin 1995, nous nous spécialisons dans la création de cas complexes, de prothèses dentaires fixes et amovibles ainsi que d’appareils orthodontiques. Toujours à l’avant-garde de la technologie, nous continuons d’offrir des produits et services adaptés aux besoins particuliers de notre clientèle. Par l’entremise de nos programmes interne de recherche et développement, nous explorons continuellement les nouvelles avancées technologiques dans la fabrication de prothèse dentaire de haute précision. 
  Description: 
  Le consultant en cas est responsable de la communication avec les clients en ce qui concerne le soutien aux cas et la planification du traitement, tout en maintenant un niveau élevé de satisfaction de la clientèle. Ce poste sera également responsable de la gestion du contrôle final de la qualité et de la formation interne de l’équipe sur les aspects techniques de tous les cas.
  
  
 Si vous avez au moins 5 ans d’expérience dans l’industrie des laboratoires dentaires, ainsi que de solides compétences en supervision, nous voulons avoir de vos nouvelles!
  
  Responsabilités Principales:
 
  Consultante en cas 
 
  Évaluer, identifier et proposer des solutions aux cas de restauration problématique 
  Discuter des options réparatrices avec les médecins par téléphone / courriel 
  S’assurer que des instructions appropriées sont données aux techniciens concernant les cas problématiques 
  
 
 Contrôle final de la qualité 
  
  S’assurer que la restauration finale et les appareils répondent aux normes de contrôle de la qualité de l’entreprise
 
  
  
  Qualifications:
  
  
  
  École technique – Certification en tant que technicien dentaire agréé ou formation et expérience équivalentes 
  5 ans d’expérience dans l’industrie des laboratoires dentaires 
  Doit être capable de gérer les personnes, les processus et la technologie 
  Doit posséder des compétences efficaces en anglais et en communication Français (à l’oral et à l’écrit) tout en offrant de solides compétences interpersonnelles 
  Excellentes compétences en gestion du temps; agit habilement avec un sentiment d’urgence 
  Grande attention aux détails et à la précision 
  Capacité à penser stratégiquement et à diriger 
  Dépannage avancé et expérience multitâche 
  Connaissance des tendances et des applications technologiques pertinentes de l’industrie

positionName: Precision High Speed 3D Camera Lab and Data Analyst (Co-Op)
description:
It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing!
   
  We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.
 
 
   If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!
 
 
   Lumentum Canada was awarded the 2022 National Capital Region’s Top Employers 
  for the 6th consecutive year and the 2022 Career Directory Canada’s Best Employers for Recent Graduates 
  for the 5th consecutive year.
 
 
   Precision High Speed 3D Camera Lab and Data Analyst
 
 
   It’s an exciting time to join Lumentum! Lumentum (NASDAQ: LITE) is a market-leading manufacturer of innovative optical and photonic products enabling optical networking and commercial laser customers worldwide. Lumentum’s optical components and subsystems are part of virtually every type of telecom, enterprise, and data center network. Lumentum’s commercial lasers enable advanced manufacturing techniques and diverse applications including next-generation 3D sensing capabilities. Lumentum is headquartered in San Jose, California with R&D, manufacturing, and sales offices worldwide. For more information, visit www.lumentum.com.
 
 
   We believe Lumentum is a great place to work, and we support a diverse and inclusive culture where employees bring their whole and authentic selves to work. We strive to build meaningful connections that fuel innovation to produce products that impact the world. We are committed to creating a diverse and welcoming workplace that includes employees with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We believe that enables us to better meet our mission and values while serving customers throughout our global communities. People of color, women, LGBTQIA+, veterans and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply.
 
 
   Overview
 
 
   Located in Ottawa, Canada, Lumentum’s R&D Team is developing a high speed, high precision 3D camera using state-of-the-art optical technology. You will part of a nimble fast-moving team that is developing this camera from the ground up. In addition to getting exposed to the technical aspect of the camera, all team members get exposed to the end-solution which involve many of the world’s top automotive manufacturers.
 
 
   The Opportunity
 
 
   We welcome candidates with work term lengths of 8 to 16 months in duration. Due to the hardware and hands-on nature of this project we require employees to be onsite.
 
 
   Responsibilities
 
 
   The 3D Camera Lab and Data Analyst responsibilities would include but not be limited to the following:
 
 
   Work in the lab measuring various automotive parts with our camera
   Analyze 3D point cloud data with PolyWorks commercial software and custom written Python code
   Develop and/or modify Python tools to improve data analysis
   Research new data analysis techniques to improve point cloud accuracy
   Conduct measurement studies - execute specific measurement plans, analyze results and produce reports
   Develop 2D/3D vision algorithms and software for 3D reconstruction and object identification
   Set up tests with instrumentation, and manage testing/tool area.
   Evidence collection, handling, and storage.
 
 
 
   Education Qualifications
 
 
   Third or fourth year students enrolled in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering or similar technical degree granting program
 
 
   Desired Skills & Qualifications
 
 
   Knowledgeable with Python and its various numerical libraries
   Understanding of 3D Point Cloud Objects and their manipulation with open 3D libraries
   Enjoy working in a lab environment & with various types of high-end test equipment
 
 
   To be considered for this opportunity…
 
 
   You must be registered full-time or part time, in a recognized Canadian post-secondary institution
 
 
   What sets Lumentum's student program apart? We're awesome because…
   Our student program offers opportunities to work on real projects that have meaningful impact in an environment that supports diverse perspectives, inclusivity and fosters a sense of belonging. We offer flexible working schedules, continuous learning, mentorship programs, employee resource groups and perks and benefits to all students - including health, dental & vision coverage, and employee wellness programs.
 
 
 
   In its seventh consecutive year, the Ottawa site is honored to be named one of the Canada Region Top Employers and one of the best employers for recent university graduates under the Career Directory for the sixth year by Canada’s Top 100 Employers!
 
 
   Lumentum awards scholarships of $5,000.00 to ten of our Canada based students from underrepresented groups. To be considered for the scholarship, the first thing you need to do is apply for a Lumentum intern/co-op opportunity so you can be reviewed for a job with us. To receive the DIB scholarship, you must complete an intern/co-op with Lumentum.
 
 
 
   You might be interested to know:
 
 
   We are a humble but passionate team who loves our work and is improving with each day;
   Our team has a long history (15 years and counting) of employing co-ops/interns and we truly value the contributions our students make to our team. In fact, several students have been hired upon graduation;
   Our building offers many perks including a small gym with showers; a cafeteria with subsidized meals and free coffee & tea; a prayer room; a games room; and plenty of free parking, or a conveniently located public transit stop in front of the building.

positionName: Sales Marketing Associate, Lab Research in Life Sci.-Ottawa/Montreal Metro
description:
GeneBio Systems is a biotech company dedicated to help our customers by providing solutions to research and clinical laboratories. GeneBio Systems was founded on the strong scientific foundation stemming from our founding team's extensive biotechnological and life science research experience. Our professionals have many years of research and development experience in pharmaceutical, medical device and life science and laboratory products.
As a result of rapid growth of our business, we are hiring additional talents to expand our team.
GeneBio is seeking outstanding applicants for a Sales/Marketing Associate I, Molecular Biology Life Science Lab Research to support ongoing sales initiatives. This position is located in
Ottawa and Montreal
Candidates currently located in a nearby community are strongly preferred.
The ideal candidate has experience in molecular biology, with BSc degree in a life science discipline, and has an ability to build relationships with clients, working with colleagues, increasing sales and providing solutions that benefit both the employer and the client. With a knowledge and passion for the life science research, and development, the successful candidate will bring energy and drive to our existing team, opening up opportunities and expanding our current business portfolio.
Responsibilities and Duties
· Represent the company in a professional, respectful manner
· Build, maintain and expand a network of (new) external relations, detect and realize new business opportunities
· Create sales and marketing presentations for a broad range of researchers in clients' laboratories or otherwise sites.
· Comfortable communicating with people at all levels, field to principal scientists
· Effectively manage timely customer and product information, forecast accuracy and provides custom solutions
· Partner with product managers managers, technical support services and sales management to strategize on new business development activities and set sales and revenue targets
· Excellent communication skills;
· Provide consistent follow up on customer communications to maintain strong professional relationships and explore ongoing and new opportunities
Qualifications and Skills
· A minimum of BSc in a life science discipline preferably with 1 or more years of experience in a laboratory; though those who graduated in the last year are also encouraged to apply
· A understanding of the sales process or willingness to acquire new skills and knowledge, and a strong passion to be successful.
· Self-motivated with the ability to develop within a dynamic, fast-paced environment
· Strong interpersonal and communication skills
· Results driven with a high sense of urgency
· Has a desire to learn and develop within the sales and marketing industry
· Working towards career progression and growth within a company
· Prior experience in sales or a customer-focused environment is an asset
Above all, driven, a go-getter who is independent, hungry for successes. Must be a great communicator.
· Must be over the age of 18 with no criminal conviction or penal offence related to the tasks and responsibilities of the role. Recent graduates are encouraged to apply.
This position is compensated in salary with a performance based bonus, with an opportunity to participate in Company's employee stock option plan and conversion to a salary based position after 12-month.

Salary: Up to $49,000.00 per year
Benefits:

 On-site parking
 Paid time off

Schedule:

 8 hour shift

 Bonus pay

 Must have a BSc in Biological discipline.

Education:

About The Ottawa Hospital 
    
    
    
     
      Inspired by research and driven by compassion!
     
      
     
     
       The Ottawa Hospital (TOH) is one of Canada’s largest learning and research multi-campus hospitals. With more than 1,100 beds and approximately 12,000 staff members, we deliver specialized care to the Eastern Ontario region. 
     
      
     
     
      From the compassion of our people to the relentless pursuit of new discoveries, The Ottawa Hospital never stops seeking solutions to the most complex health-care challenges while continually engaging with the community to support our vision for better patient care.
     
      
     
     
       Working together with its research institute, the University of Ottawa, and other partners, the hospital is continually gaining national and international recognition for high-quality patient care, teaching and research, while striving to meet the needs of the culturally diverse community we serve.
      
    
   
  
 
 
  
   Position Information 
    
    
    
     
      Electrophysiology Lab/Cardiac Catheterization Lab
     
     
       
       Temporary until approximately March 30, 2024.
      
    
   
  
 
 
  
   Rotation/Shifts 
    
    
    
     
      Days, evenings and night, including weekends, 8 hour shifts. Must be available for standby and call back (nights) - 30 minutes return time to work.
     
     
      For information purposes only - The Hospital reserves the right to change.
      
    
   
  
 
 
  
   Basic Requirements 
    
    
    
     
      
       
        Current Certificate of Competence in the Province of Ontario;
        
      
       
        Current Cardiac catheterization laboratory experience;
        
      
       
        Two (2) years Critical Care experience;
        
      
       
        Completion of Critical Care course;
        
      
       
        E.C.G. interpretation;
        
      
       
        Current certification for B.C.L.S.;
        
      
       
        Must be eligible to work in Canada;
        
      
       
        Proficiency in English and French – oral expression (advanced level) and comprehension (advanced level).
        
     
     
     
      Language proficiency requirements are based on the nature of the position and the level of interaction with French- and English-speaking clients.
      
    
   
  
 
 
  
   Preferred Qualifications 
    
    
    
     
      
       
        O.R. certification;
        
      
       
        Current O.R. and C.O.R. experience.
        
     
    
   
  
 
 
  
   What you can expect from us 
    
    
    
     
      The Ottawa Hospital is committed to providing a healthy, safe, and inclusive work environment for everyone. We are driven by our purpose to provide each patient with the world-class care, exceptional service and compassion we would want for our loved ones.
     
      
     
     
       We offer an attractive and equitable compensation package including a comprehensive benefits package, a Defined Benefit Pension (DBP) plan, and insurance protection. We also offer discounts from choice providers on a variety of products and services. 
     
      
     
     
      The Ottawa Hospital provides various Health and Wellness resources as well as opportunities for personal and professional development opportunities from our in-house Learning and Leadership Development team to help align your goals with your career objectives.
      
    
   
  
 
 
  
   Interested? Apply today! 
    
    
    
     
      If you are passionate about what you do, motivated by improving the health of the community, excited by leading-edge medical technology, and as committed to excellence, quality and patient safety as we are, we would like to hear from you. Please submit an on-line application for the position you are interested in. We thank all those who apply but only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.
     
     
       The Ottawa Hospital is an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, accommodations due to a disability are available throughout the recruitment process.

Position Overview 
  Calian is looking for Intermediate Technician for a Fuel Laboratory in Gatineau. 
 
  
   
     Location
    
      Gatineau, QC
    
   
   
     Job Type
    
      Full Time
    
   
  
  
 Responsibilities 
 
  Provide technical support to the section or the development of other ISO 17025, training and/or information management; proposing suitable procedures and appropriate recommendations in order to improve work quality 
  Plan and organize work to meet deadlines. Analyze, evaluate and resolve technical problems in a logical manner 
  Draft and maintain SOPs associated with ISO 17025 certification 
  Draft general correspondence and provide briefings in order to communicate issues, resolve problems, update work status, and disseminate information 
  Coordinate quality system audits and assist in the performance of quality system audits 
 
 Qualifications 
 
  Must currently hold or be eligible for Secret – Level II Clearance with the Government of Canada 
  College certificate in analytical chemistry or 9 years of experience in the past 15 as a technician performing chemical analysis 
  Four years of experience in providing advice and direction on regulations, acquisition and control of petroleum, oil, fuels, and lubricants related to but not limited to aviation 
  One year of experience in coordinating the field audits and assisting in the performance of field audits at fueling facilities

WHO WE ARE: 
  As part of the team at EVIK Diagnostics Innovations you’ll discover meaningful work within the medical device industry. You’ll join a rapidly growing company where each day is different, and opportunities are approached with a team effort.
  
  
  Evik was established in 2011 and is based in Kanata (in the same building as a brewery!) Our team are experts in the field of creating rapid, single-assay lyophilized beads for immunological and molecular diagnostics. Our DxSpheres are used for a wide variety of different testing applications including rapid PCR Covid test kits, and in environmental water testing laboratories. Our clients are located around the world and appreciate our transparency, communication, and ability to go the extra mile.
  
  
  If you’d like to learn more about us and what we do, feel free to check out our website and watch our company video.
  
  
  Evik Diagnostic Innovations is an Ottawa based ISO 13485:2016 certified manufacturer of rapid, single-assay, lyophilized beads for immunological and molecular diagnostics using dry reagent components. We provide exceptional customer service to our clients, and we are looking for a new team member to help us continue to exceed their expectations. You are an ideal candidate if you are looking to become part of a dynamic team.
 
  JOB DESCRIPTION 
  The Research Associate is responsible for working directly with the Director of Technology to provide support for lyophilizing process development, optimization and scaling up. 
 
  
 KEY RESPONSIBILITIES 
  
  Adhere to current good laboratory and manufacturing practices and maintain a safe and clean work environment. 
  Perform thermal analysis of complex reagent mixtures and dry reagents, using DSC, FDM and other analytical methods. 
  Setup automated stations dispense parameters assuring uniformity of the dispensed mixes and suspensions. 
  Collect client custom product characterization and packaging requirements and verify client instructions were followed. 
  Perform DSC and FDM methods, other material testing methods according to the standard protocols. 
  Measure, observe and document freeze-dry products morphology and physical properties. 
  Summarize thermal properties testing and analytical testing data and results of the experiments. 
  Understand freeze-dry cycles settings based on thermal and physical properties of lyophilized products. 
  Communicate results and collaborate with other professionals in the lab and clients. 
  Provide technical presentation and technical support for client’s projects. 
  Write and edit work instructions. 
  Maintain product development database and logbooks. 
  Process, organize and summarize data using a variety of word processing and spreadsheet software applications. 
  Perform related laboratory maintenance such as maintaining and cleaning equipment, ordering supplies, calibrating R&D equipment, and maintaining inventories of incoming materials and laboratory supplies. 
  Manage multiple tasks and changing priorities in a fast-paced environment. 
  Other tasks as required to support the smooth operation of the laboratory. 
  Participate in Process Improvement projects assigned by manager.
 
  
  
  SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS 
  
  Ability to work without direct supervision, paying close attention to detail and bearing independent responsibility for data accuracy. 
  Sound organizational and data management skills. 
  Ability to handle several responsibilities and work under tight time constraints. 
  Dedication to production quality and deadlines with a strong work ethic. 
  Proficiency in MS Word and MS Excel, including basic functions and formulas. 
  Ability to work well as part of a team. 
  A positive attitude and professional appearance and manner. 
  Good English language communication skills both written and oral.
 
  
  
  EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE 
  
  Master’s or Bachelor's degree in physics, physical chemistry, or material sciences. 
  Two to five years of industrial laboratory work experience. 
  Hands on experience with Differential Scanning Calorimetry and materials thermal analysis methods and techniques is an asset. 
  Deep understanding of underlying scientific principles. 
  Experience in freeze-dry protocols development considered as a big asset. 
  Experience with freeze-dry microscopy is an asset.
 
  
  
  OTHER 
  
  Applicants should be available for an on-site interview. 
  Applicants must include a resume and a cover letter in which they describe how they meet each of the requirements listed above.

LifeLabs is the largest community diagnostics laboratory in Canada, serving the healthcare needs of Canadians for over 50 years. Our team members are truly centred around our customers, and we know that behind every lab requisition, sample being tested, or investment in technology is an individual and their family counting on us. 
 Consistently named one of Canada's Best Employers by Forbes, LifeLabs has also been recognized for having an award-winning Mental Health Program from Benefits Canada. The passion and commitment of over 6,000 diverse and innovative team members unites and motivates us to ensure our customers receive high quality tests and results that they can trust. Agile, customer-centred, caring and teamwork: we live these values every day in what we do to support our customers and healthcare providers, driving forward our vision of empowering a healthier you.
  Make a difference – join the LifeLabs team today!
 
  As a Lab Patient Technician, you will be responsible for the specimen collection process, from greeting patients through to preparation of specimens for transportation. This is an important role in patient care and our business and will let you see the difference that you make in patients’ lives.
 
  This is a Part-Time position at 139 Greenbank Road, Ottawa, ON.
 
  The successful candidate will support at the Greenbank site and the Centre point site weekdays and may occasionally be scheduled on Saturday mornings at the Carling site.
  In this role you will:
  
 
   Greet and request required information from patients, explain the specimen collection process, and ensure patients have followed necessary test protocol prior to specimen collection.
   Perform phlebotomies, connect/disconnect Holter monitors, and perform ECG tracings.
   Perform special test collections, such as medical/legal drug screens, paternity tests, and clinical trials, and complete related documentation.
   Maintain client relationships, including responding to inquiries and following up on requests.
   Complete data entry of required patient demographics, requisition information, and other information related to processing test results.
   Prepare specimens for transportation and testing.
 
 
  The right person for this role will be focused on great customer/patient service and be able to relate to patients and clients even in stressful situations. Some key qualities include empathy, flexibility, adaptability to change, and problem-solving skills. Other requirements include
  
 
   Graduate of an approved Laboratory Assistant program or equivalent.
   Phlebotomy experience.
   Excellent communication skills.

Overview: 
 
   Merrick and Company is a nationally known multi-office and multi-discipline firm consisting of a diverse, dedicated and talented staff which has achieved design excellence throughout its 60+ years of existence. With offices worldwide, Merrick and Company has been ranked as one of the top 100 design firms by Engineering News Record. Merrick provides personalized services to various clients throughout the world. We are seeking an experienced Laboratory / Facility Electrical Engineer for our Life Sciences business unit in our Kanata office.
 
 
   Candidates that have a desire for personal and professional growth, a well-defined understanding of design and construction document processes, and adaptability for short term and long-term projects in an environment that requires a blend of creativity and high technical skills. Successful candidates must be self-starting, motivated, innovative, articulate, self-disciplined, and confident in a demanding, exciting and fast-paced environment. This position requires a competent professional engineer who will be responsible for all phases of engineering production and BIM for a variety of work ranging from programming through construction administration. This includes interpreting, organizing, executing and coordinating the design and production effort for one or more large or complex projects.
 
 
 
   Job Description
 
 
   Design of electrical systems for facilities / laboratories for Government, University, and private clients.
   Provide conceptual / detailed design and analysis for facility power distribution (600V), site power distribution (15kV), emergency power generation, grounding and lightning protection, lighting design, telecommunications (voice/data), fire alarm / mass notification, security, access control, and special systems.
   Provide supporting documentation such as calculations, reports, and specifications.
   This individual is expected to possess extensive knowledge on electrical regulatory codes.
   Meet with clients to prepare and/or validate proposed scope of work.
   Prepare fee proposals for engineering design work.
   Work with other disciplines to ensure accuracy of the package, meet schedule, and budget commitments and meet expectations for attendance and punctuality.
   Ability to communicate clearly and concisely; both verbally and in writing
   Ability to work effectively within a collaborative team environment
   Ability to complete tasks with accuracy and with strong attention to detail
   Ability to consistently meet deadlines, completing tasks as previously defined
   Ability to travel as needed.
   Ability to write and edit specifications
   Work in a design team environment, including directing and mentoring the work of junior engineers and designers, and delegating work as required as well as provide management of the local team.
   Capable of performing all of the above with minimal direction
   An agreed upon hybrid schedule, working from both home and office, is available to employees in good standing.
 
 
   Required Experience
 
 
   Eight (8) years of experience in facility Electrical Engineering design
   Professional Engineer (P.E.) license is required
   Minimum four (4) years of experience using REVIT/AutoCAD or other design software-based drawing generation
   Experience using electrical calculation tools is desired, including lighting and power software such as AGi32, Elum Tools, SKM Power Tools, ETAP, and EasyPower.
   Proficient using Microsoft Office Excel & Word
   Experience with technical codes such as NEC, NESC, NFPA, IEEE is required
   Experience with USDA, ARS, CDC and other laboratory clients is highly desired
   Client projects for this position require Canadian Citizenship.
   Local candidates are preferred.
 
 
   Physical Requirements
 
 
   Requires the ability to sit for extended periods at a computer workstation.
   Be able to work in an environment with open discussions and visitors without getting distracted.
   May be required to lift up to 20 lbs.
   Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
   Meets expectations for attendance and punctuality.
   The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.
 
  Additional information:
 
   Apply online only. No e-mail, hard copy or third-party resumes accepted.
   Merrick & Company offers a competitive compensation and benefits package which includes RRSP, and unique work-life benefits.
   We recognize the importance of developing top talent from within, our employees have access to a wide range of internal and external training and coaching programs and are rewarded for their achievements through excellent benefits and competitive salaries.
   Merrick & Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability/vets.

Ciena is committed to our people-first philosophy. Our teams enjoy a culture focused on prioritizing a personalized and flexible work environment that empowers an individual’s passions, growth, wellbeing and belonging. We’re a technology company that leads with our humanity—driving our business priorities alongside meaningful social, community, and societal impact. 
 
 Why Ciena?
 
   We’re a company rooted in people—seeking to create a vibrant and inclusive environment, where everyone feels they can belong.
   Accelerate your career path by gaining hands-on experience and exposure to the latest technology. Our interns and graduates work on real projects in real time in world class labs. Be a part of tomorrow’s future – today.
 
 
   Mentoring. Networking. Leadership Opportunities. We recognize that the learning doesn’t stop when you leave school - we champion a team environment for development and provide the tools to achieve success.
   We are big proponents of life-work integration. Our people make a big difference at Ciena, but we want to shine light on their differences outside of working hours too. CienaCares supports non-profit causes important to employees by matching employee financial contributions and dedicating time for volunteering.
 
 
  The Opportunity:
  8 month work term: January – August 2024
 
  How You Will Contribute:
 
  Ciena’s Management, Control and Plan (MCP) Applications is a next generation Network Management solution for IP, Packet, and Optical networks. Based on microservices architecture, MCP Applications helps Network operators plan, provision, and troubleshoot multi-layer networks quickly using a highly intuitive user interface in addition to available open REST APIs. As a QA Automation developer, you will:
 
   Create REST API automation using postman/JavaScript and
   Maintain automation builds on CI/CD platform (TeamCity).
   Work closely with our team of developers QA Engineers to design, develop, execute, and maintain automated test scripts
 
  What Does Ciena Expect of You? 
 
  A sense of urgency – what’s important to the customer is equally important to you. You make getting things done a priority.
   Integrity – you hold yourself to the highest level of personal and professional standards of conduct.
   A commitment to innovation – you continually seek to learn, understand new technologies and ever-changing market conditions, and endeavor to apply that knowledge to Ciena’s advantage. 
  You embrace change – thriving in a diverse environment of ever-changing priorities and sometimes stressful situations.
   The flexibility to work independently with minimal supervision as well as part of a broader team.
 
 
  The Must Haves:
 
   Software programming experience in JavaScript
   Experience with Postman
   Understanding of REST APIs, JSON, and XML
   Understanding of Windows, UNIX Operating systems
   Knowledge of basic Linux commands
   Enthusiasm for Automation development and willingness to learn
   Ability to estimate, prioritize, plan, and coordinate testing activities within the Development Team
 
  Assets:
 
   Familiarity with Agile Scrum, Agile JIRA, Bitbucket and TeamCity
 
  Experience with web services and API testing; experience testing microservices is a plus
 
  At Ciena, we are committed to building and fostering an environment in which our employees feel respected, valued, and heard. Ciena values the diversity of its workforce and respects its employees as individuals. We do not tolerate any form of discrimination.
 
  If contacted in relation to a job opportunity, please advise Ciena of any accommodation measures you may require.

What You'll Do
 
 
   You will be part of the Global Lab Solutions (GLS) team, which is responsible for day-to-day lab operations for more than one (1) million square feet of Engineering lab space world-wide as well as designing, delivering, and managing programs for the governance of Cisco Engineering Labs.
 
 
   Your role will involve providing general operational network and system administration support for GLS-managed, Engineering Labs in Ottawa, Canada.
 
 
 
   Who You'll Work With
 
 
   Are you excited to be part of the next wave of Internet? Our team works alongside outstanding Cisco engineers who are at the leading edge of defining and creating compelling next generation technology and solutions. You will be making a significant contribution on the Cisco products as part of a passionate team that is redefining this industry.
 
 
   GLS is a centralized team of approximately 80 talented professionals who focus on driving standard methodologies and encouraging innovation across Engineering Labs through collaboration, data, teamwork, and technology.
 
 
 
   What You’ll Do:
 
 
   The Lab Engineer will provide network, system administration and general operational support for Engineering labs located on the Ottawa campus, Cisco Systems Canada. This position will be lead for the GLS Ottawa team and will advise the members of the team in providing logistical support to lab clients, including equipment installation, network connectivity, shipping & receiving, inventory control, RMA support, e-waste disposal, EHS/safety inspections, ISO audits, etc.
 
 
   Ottawa GLS team leadership
   Installation, monitoring, debug, and maintenance of GLS Ottawa Lab network infrastructure.
   Installation of servers and related operating systems (OS)
   Installation, configuration and troubleshooting of Ottawa Lab Users’ testbeds and supporting equipment.
   Provision and support of virtual solutions such as vCenter/ESXi, including troubleshooting and configuration.
   Installing / supporting the installation of security patches for: Linux, Windows and ESXi systems as directed by Cisco Information Security.
   Maintaining excellent client relationships with local Business Unit (BU) leaders and GLS clients.
 
 
 
   Basic Qualifications:
 
 
   Cisco Certifications: CCNA or CCNP required; CCIE recommended.
   Proven understanding of Cisco router and switch product lines with a detailed understanding of Cisco Internet Operating Systems. (IOS, IOS XE, IOS XR, NX-OS)
   Proficiency in server-based operating systems. PC / Windows, Linux OS types and desktop and server applications: WINS, DHCP, NT domain structure, domain controllers, group policies, etc.
 
 
 
   Preferred Qualifications:
 
 
   Knowledge of auto-mounters and communication protocols: NFS, TFTP, FTP, SSH, SCP, DNS, LISP, NIS+. TCP/IP, subnetting, routing protocols, Ethernet media.
   Understanding of LAN switching and configuration of VLAN’s and Spanning Tree Protocol.
   Solid grasp of active directory (AD) and the ability to troubleshoot Linux AD connections via Vintela.
   Knowledge of KVM, Openstack, Docker and ESXi.
   Knowledge of scripting and web services: Python, Bash Shell, Apache, NGINX
   Knowledge on networking monitoring tools: Nagios, Zabbix, Wireshark
   Self-starter who is able to work independently.
   Good communication and collaboration skills to work across multiple GLS teams, with local clients and leaders, and with partner organizations (Cisco IT, WPR, Security & Trust Org (STO), etc.)
   Highly organized, with the ability to structure/manage projects.
 
 
 
   Why Cisco?
 
 
   #WeAreCisco. We are all unique, but collectively we bring our talents to work as a team, to develop innovative technology and power a more inclusive, digital future for everyone. How do we do it? Well, for starters – with people like you!
 
 
   Nearly every internet connection around the world touches Cisco. We’re the Internet’s optimists. Our technology makes sure the data traveling at light speed across connections does so securely, yet it’s not what we make but what we make happen which marks us out. We’re helping those who work in the health service to connect with patients and each other; schools, colleges, and universities to teach in even the most challenging of times. We’re helping businesses of all shapes and sizes to connect with their employees and customers in new ways, providing people with access to the digital skills they need and connecting the most remote parts of the world – whether through 5G, or otherwise.
 
 
   We tackle whatever challenges come our way. We have each other’s backs, we recognize our accomplishments, and we grow together. We celebrate and support one another – from big and small things in life to big career moments. And giving back is in our DNA (we get 10 days off each year to do just that).
 
 
   We know that powering an inclusive future starts with us. Because without diversity and a dedication to equality, there is no moving forward. Our 30 Inclusive Communities, that bring people together around commonalities or passions, are leading the way. Together we’re committed to learning, listening, caring for our communities, whilst supporting the most vulnerable with a collective effort to make this world a better place either with technology, or through our actions.
 
 
   So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us! #WeAreCisco
 
 


 Message to applicants applying to work in the U.S.:
  
  
 
  When available, the salary range posted for this position reflects the projected hiring range for new hire, full-time salaries in U.S. locations, not including equity or benefits. Hiring ranges for sales positions include base and incentive compensation target. Individual pay is determined by the candidate's hiring location and additional factors, including but not limited to skillset, experience, and relevant education, certifications, or training. Applicants may not be eligible for the full salary range based on their U.S. hiring location.   U.S. employees have 
  access to quality medical, dental and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with a Cisco matching contribution, short and long-term disability coverage, basic life insurance and numerous wellbeing offerings. Employees receive up to twelve paid holidays per calendar year, which includes one floating holiday, plus a day off for their birthday. Employees accrue up to 20 days of Paid Time Off (PTO) each year and have access to paid time away to deal with critical or emergency issues without tapping into their PTO. We offer additional paid time to volunteer and give back to the community. Employees are also able to purchase company stock through our Employee Stock Purchase Program.
  
 
  Employees on sales plans earn performance-based incentive pay on top of their base salary, which is split between quota and non-quota components. For quota-based incentive pay, Cisco pays at the standard rate of 1% of incentive target for each 1% revenue attainment against the quota up to 100%. Once performance exceeds 100% quota attainment, incentive rates may increase up to five times the standard rate with no cap on incentive compensation. For non-quota-based sales performance elements such as strategic sales objectives, Cisco may pay up to 125% of target. Cisco sales plans do not have a minimum threshold of performance for sales incentive compensation to be paid.

positionName: Jr Technical Expertise Centre - Lab Tech
description:
Come create the technology that helps the world act together 
 Nokia is committed to innovation and technology leadership across mobile, fixed and cloud networks. Your career here will have a positive impact on people’s lives and will help us build the capabilities needed for a more productive, sustainable, and inclusive world. 
 We challenge ourselves to create an inclusive way of working where we are open to new ideas, empowered to take risks and fearless to bring our authentic selves to work. 
 The team you'll be part of 
 The pandemic has highlighted how important telecoms networks are to society. Nokia’s Network Infrastructure group is at the heart of a revolution to bring more and faster network capacity to people worldwide through our ambition, innovation, and technical expertise. 
 This is a Tier 3 Support role where Regional TAC Engineer (Tier 2) will escalate to the person in this role i.e., Technical Expertise Engineer. In this role, you will provide remote Technical Support for the IP TEC 7250 IXR, 7250 SONIC & 7705 SAR solutions and associated network elements. As a product expert you will work closely with the H/W and S/W design teams, customer teams and sales teams to support our external customers. 
 What you will learn and contribute to 
 
  Interface, develop and maintain strong relationships with external and internal customers, remotely to troubleshoot/answer questions. This will involve accessing the remote sites, reviewing log files, coordinating the duplication or testing of the issue, building lab setups, gathering traces, logs, files, etc., for critical support, and so on. 
  Assist with debugging complex product installations, resolves complicated product problems by applying both established procedures and creative alternatives. 
  Interface, develop and maintain strong relationships with select members of the design team, Solution Teams, customer teams, PLM and Product Business Units. 
  Ensure transfer of knowledge amongst the support organization and provide New Product Introduction training to other support organization 
  
 As part of our team, you will: 
 
  Use your analytical skills to isolate issues 
  Discover network design techniques 
  Develop an intense knowledge of IP protocols 
  Learn to lean on your team-mates for help 
  
 Your skills and experience 
 You have: 
 
  Bachelor's Degree/College Diploma in Computer/Software/Electrical Engineering, Information Technology, Computer Science, or Equivalent education or experience. 
  Experience with IP Networking is a must have 
  Experience in Routing / Switching 
  
 It would be nice if you also had: 
 
  Experience in Hardware industry 
  Experience troubleshooting software or network problems 
  Experience and understanding of Virtual Private Network L2 and L3 solutions and OSPF, BGP, Routing/Switching protocols 
  Knowledge of IP/MPLS, routing and switching techniques 
  Knowledge of developing scripts for automated testing 
  
 What we offer 
 Nokia offers flexible and hybrid working schemes, continuous learning opportunities, well-being programs to support you mentally and physically, opportunities to join and get supported by employee resource groups, mentoring programs and highly diverse teams with an inclusive culture where people thrive and are empowered. 
 Nokia is committed to inclusion and is an equal opportunity employer 
 Nokia has received the following recognitions for its commitment to inclusion & equality: 
 
  One of the World’s Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere 
  Gender-Equality Index by Bloomberg 
  Workplace Pride Global Benchmark 
  LGBT+ equality & best place to work by HRC Foundation 
  
 At Nokia, we act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people. 
 Nokia’s employment selections are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. 
 We are committed to a culture of inclusion built upon our core value of respect. 
 Join us and be part of a company where you will feel included and empowered to succeed.

Introduction
   Chez IBM, nos directeurs de projet excellent en dirigeant et en coordonnant le rendement global, la portée, le coût et les produits livrables d'une équipe de projet. Nos clients s'appuient sur des rapports d'état opportuns et efficaces, et en tant que directeurs de projets, vous serez responsable de l'orientation du projet, de la définition des paramètres et de la gestion du rendement. Si vous êtes prêts à aider nos clients et nos équipes de projets à réussir, nous aimerions vous rencontrer!
   
   
  Votre rôle et vos responsabilités
   La responsabilité principale du directeur de projet consiste à gérer les efforts des ressources IBM, des employés du client et des fournisseurs tiers pour s'assurer qu'une solution intégrée répond aux besoins du client. À titre de directeur principal de projet au sein du Bureau de gestion des projets (PMO), vous dirigerez des équipes interfonctionnelles pour réaliser des projets qui s'étendent sur plusieurs unités commerciales. En utilisant les meilleures pratiques de gestion de projet, vous serez responsable de la livraison d'un portefeuille de projets. Le directeur de projet travaille de façon autonome, mais informe rapidement la direction de l'état d'avancement des travaux, soulève les questions et les risques au niveau approprié et au moment opportun, travaille de façon efficace et efficiente avec un minimum de supervision, conseille et guide les autres professionnels, cherche à obtenir des conseils sur les questions critiques, s'il y a lieu, et possède un solide niveau d'expertise en gestion de projet. Le directeur de projet est responsable de l'exécution du plan de projet global, du budget, de la structure, de l'échéancier et des exigences en matière de dotation en personnel de l'organisation.
   
   Principales responsabilités du poste
   
  
   Assurer une discipline de gestion de projet et un cadre pour les équipes de projet Expert Labs.
    Fournir une orientation et un contrôle techniques pour coordonner et gérer les activités du personnel de projet Expert Labs.
    Identifier, suivre et gérer les dépendances des projets afin d'assurer une utilisation optimale des ressources, l'identification continue des risques et la réalisation rapide des avantages du projet.
    Identifier les parties prenantes et les gérer à différents niveaux au sein de l'organisation, en adaptant votre style et votre approche à leurs besoins, en personne et à distance.
    Tenir des réunions régulières avec les clients et les parties prenantes du projet.
    Organiser et présenter l'information sur le projet de façon complète et appropriée en fonction de l'auditoire et de la situation, y compris produire des rapports à l'intention de la direction.
    Fournir des prévisions financières aux chefs de la prestation.
    Maintenir la cadence de gestion avec les chefs de la prestation afin de fournir des informations sur l'état du projet.
    Administrer la procédure de contrôle des modifications au contrat avec le client.
    Maintenir la communication sur le projet avec le client et gérer les attentes du client.
    Utilisation du processus de recours hiérarchique et gestion des situations critiques. Capacité de clarifier clairement l'énoncé du problème. Avoir recours à la méthode de résolution des problèmes, la pensée critique et l'analyse des causes fondamentales pour disséquer les questions complexes. Générer, évaluer et mettre en œuvre des solutions possibles et surveiller les résultats.
    Aider à estimer et à évaluer les nouveaux projets.
    Créer des livrables de gestion de projet (rapports d'état, suivi financier, plan de projet, risques, problèmes, actions, journaux de décisions, etc.)
    Développer une connaissance des offres d'Integration Expert Labs avec une sensibilisation aux nouvelles technologies et solutions.
  
   
   Expertise professionnelle et technique requise
   
  
    Baccalauréat ou diplôme avec 4 années d'expérience au sein d'une organisation de services consultatifs aux clients.
    Maîtrise de l'anglais et du français: Posséinez d'excellentes compétences en communication écrite et verbale en français et en anglais et doivent être basées au Canada.
    Certification de gestion de projet (PMP, Scrum Master, PMI-ACP, ou autres certifications)
    Expérience et compétence dans l'utilisation de MS Project et d'autres outils de gestion de projet.
    Expérience de travail avec plusieurs méthodologies de projet (cascade, Agile, Scrum)
    Solides compétences en communication verbale et écrite.
    Expérience de la communication avec les chefs opérationnels.
    Expérience de travail dans un environnement de bureau virtuel et maintien d'une présence active et dynamique par téléphone, Slack et courriel.
    Excellentes compétences en gestion des relations et en facilitation.
    Leadership personnel solide et compétences en gestion avec un style de collaboration.
    Capacité de voyager jusqu'à 50 % du temps au besoin.

Children’s Hospital of Eastern Ontario Research Institute (“CHEO RI”) is the research arm of the Children’s Hospital of Eastern Ontario – Ottawa Children’s Treatment Centre (“CHEO”) and an affiliated institute of the University of Ottawa. CHEO is a beloved institution and workplace that is widely recognized for being an anchor in our community. CHEO RI works to create new knowledge and evidence to support CHEO in its provision of world-class care to our children. Our mission at CHEORI is to connect exceptional talent and technology in pursuit of life-changing research for every child, youth and family in our community and beyond.
CHEO RI has an immediate requirement for a Research Assistant.
The Clinical Research Assistant will assist the research team in the day-to-day activities involved in the conduct of research including, but not limited to, the creation and maintenance of research files according to study guidelines, the collection, scoring and coding of research information, patient recruitment including screening and obtaining informed consents, processing of lab samples.
MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES
Under the general supervision of the Manager, Development and Rehabilitation, the Research Assistant will:

 Assist with REB and/or grant submissions and updates to those submissions as needed
 Assist with creation and/or modification of slides for presentations
 Be responsible for patient recruitment including screening and obtaining informed consents
 Be responsible for the creation and maintenance of research files according to study guidelines (Good Clinical Practice Guidelines)
 Be responsible for keeping an inventory of research measures and relaying information to the ordering agent
 Be responsible for the collection, scoring, and coding of research information.
 Will assist in the database design and be responsible for the maintenance of the databases and the data dictionary
 Be responsible for data entry and data integrity
 Identifying children and their families eligible to be recruited to the study
 Conduct baseline interviews
 Collect follow up data
 Create and maintain research and project files
 Be responsible for the collection, scoring, and coding of research information
 Assist as needed with other administrative duties related to ongoing research
 Perform work in accordance with the provisions of the Occupational Health and Safety Act and Regulations and all CHEO corporate/departmental policies and procedures related to OccupationalHealth and Safety
 Perform other related duties as assigned by supervisor

QUALIFICATIONS, SKILL AND ABILITIES

 University undergraduate degree in a health-related field such as Bachelor of Science or Social Science Degree, preferably in psychology, neuroscience , or related field (Essential)
 Minimum 1 year of clinical research experience (Preferred)
 Understanding of research design, procedures, guidelines and standards governing clinical research including Personal Health Information Protection Act (Essential)
 Data management experience (REDCap) (Preferred)
 Proficiency in computer skills (Microsoft Office) (Essential)
 Excellent communication (verbal and written), interpersonal and organizational skills (Essential)
 Demonstrated collegiality, professionalism and team skills (Essential)
 Demonstrated initiative, flexibility, and ability to work independently (Essential)
 GCP, TPCS-2, certifications (Preferred)
 Bilingualism (English/French) is an asset (Preferred)

WORKING CONDITIONS

 Clinic setting work within hospital; exposure to children and parents and/or caregivers.
 Flexibility to work remotely in a hybrid work model that would include both remote work and on-site work.

OTHER REQUIREMENTS

 Eligible to work in Canada;
 Compliance with CHEO RI’s Universal COVID-19 Vaccination Policy; and
 Police Record Check.

The Bruyère Research Institute partners with Bruyère Continuing Care, the University of Ottawa and other stakeholders to conduct relevant and practical health sciences research related to medical education and improving the quality of life for the aging population and people requiring continuing care.
  
  
  
  
 Function Summary We are a research team led by Dr. Daniel Kobewka, who is an investigator at the Bruyère Research Institute (BRI) and is a clinical scientist at The Ottawa Hospital Research Institute (OHRI). Our team focuses on building evidence that informs care planning and shared decision-making, for older patients and those at the end of life.
  
  Our research team is focused on improving communication and decision making for people with serious illness and for those nearing the end of their lives. During serious illness treatments to prolong life may not work in some cases cause harm by increasing discomfort or prolonging suffering. For people with serious illness open communication about their goals and wishes is critical. Unfortunately, when communication does not happen, treatments that are inconsistent with their goals may be administered. Serious illness care needs to be informed by what matters most to the person and by realistic prognoses for the outcomes that matter most to people. Our lab works to create values clarification tools and prognostic models to inform serious illness decision making. Join us in this important work.
  
  We are looking for an experienced and motivated Research Associate to join our research team. This role participates in the conceptualization and development of the ongoing and future programs of research and team growth by contributing to all aspects of the research design, analysis and dissemination. These activities include coaching and mentorship of team members and collaborators, the development of research objectives, grant development, maintaining data integrity, and strong methodological contributions to planning and executing both qualitative/quantitative analyses.
  
  
  
  
 Main duties and responsibilities
 
   Undertake and contribute to health research projects of varying complexity applying appropriate quantitative and/or qualitative research methods (e.g., literature reviews, interviews, surveys, and statistical models)
   Produce high quality, well written research reports, data analysis plans, executive summaries, blogs, data visualizations, and proposals
   Interpret data results with ease and clarity into key messages and visualizations for a range of audiences
   Plan and write grant proposals – this includes but is not limited to budget planning, literature review, administrative grant tasks, collaborator meetings, updates, or requests for specific feedback
   Plan budget for individual projects and programs of research – reviewing current budgets and estimating the required funds overtime
   Maintain up-to-date administrative records of institutional research ethics and ICES privacy documentation for each ongoing and completed project
   Support team cohesion and growth, which includes providing mentorship to team members to improve their skills, knowledge, independence, confidence, and/or provide experience in a new area
   Manage the project – this may include both leading projects and coaching other project leads (e.g., collaborating clinical expert, junior team member, student, etc.) in planning a project (typically a manuscript within a series of projects) and helping ensure each step is executed according to timelines, budget, and research standards
   Communicate effectively with team members, clinical collaborators, colleagues, research advisors, patient partners, and external stakeholders
   Provide logistical support for research-related tasks – this may include scheduling, hosting, attending regular meetings, as well as ongoing administrative and collaborator correspondence
   Communicate and coordinate with Research Institutes’ Finance and HR teams as it pertains to team management (namely for budgeting, staff hiring, and onboarding)
   Develop and maintain systems to track progress of research projects and stakeholder outreach
   Additional duties may be added as projects progress
 
  Required Qualifications and competencies
 
   Graduate degree (MSc or PhD) in biostatistics, epidemiology, or equivalent
   Minimum four (4) years’ experience in clinical or health services research, including leading or managing multi-year studies
   Demonstrated training and experience in quantitative study design and methodology 
  Experience in study or project management in an academic research environment 
  Experience with peer-mentorship or mentorship of research students and/or staff 
  Exceptional writing skills and ability to communicate effectively across a variety of audiences
   Proven expertise leading research studies (e.g., peer-reviewed publications or other research products)
   Demonstrated expertise with advanced data analysis techniques
   Knowledge of computer software packages including Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint
   Ability to work independently and collaboratively
   Strong organizational and interpersonal skills
   Ability to set priorities, deliver high quality products and meet deadlines
   Excellent communication skills, written and oral, in English
   Fluent in French and English, an asset
 
  Preferred Competencies
 
   Experience with ICES data, either internally (analyst or student) or as collaborating researcher or research staff
   Experience writing grants and peer-reviewed publications
   Experience in designing studies, conducting statistical analyses (i.e., R-Programming, SAS, STATA, etc.) and interpreting the results
   Proactive approach to study planning, with an understanding of the research lifecycle for both health services and clinical research projects
   Experience in the following areas is an asset: predictive modelling, systematic reviews, clinical decision-making, older adult populations, end-of-life or long-term care research
 
 
   If you are interested in this opportunity, please submit your cover letter and resume to
 
 
   BRI-HR@bruyere.org
 
 
   Attention Human Resources with subject line “Research Associate I – Dr. Kobewka”,
 
 
   no later than October 6, 2023.
 
 
   Please note that incomplete applications may not be reviewed.
 
  Bruyère Research Institute is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment based on skills and experience as outlined in your CV and cover letter.

The Bruyère Research Institute partners with Bruyère Continuing Care, the University of Ottawa and other stakeholders to conduct relevant and practical health sciences research related to medical education and improving the quality of life for the aging population and people requiring continuing care.
  
  
  
  
 Function Summary We are a research team led by Dr. Daniel Kobewka, who is an investigator at the Bruyère Research Institute (BRI) and is a clinical scientist at The Ottawa Hospital Research Institute (OHRI). Our team focuses on building evidence that informs care planning and shared decision-making, for older patients and those at the end of life.
  
  Our research team is focused on improving communication and decision making for people with serious illness and for those nearing the end of their lives. During serious illness treatments to prolong life may not work in some cases cause harm by increasing discomfort or prolonging suffering. For people with serious illness open communication about their goals and wishes is critical. Unfortunately, when communication does not happen, treatments that are inconsistent with their goals may be administered. Serious illness care needs to be informed by what matters most to the person and by realistic prognoses for the outcomes that matter most to people. Our lab works to create values clarification tools and prognostic models to inform serious illness decision making. Join us in this important work.
  
  We are looking for an experienced and motivated Research Associate to join our research team. This role participates in the conceptualization and development of the ongoing and future programs of research and team growth by contributing to all aspects of the research design, analysis and dissemination. These activities include coaching and mentorship of team members and collaborators, the development of research objectives, grant development, maintaining data integrity, and strong methodological contributions to planning and executing both qualitative/quantitative analyses.
  
  
  
  
 Main duties and responsibilities
 
   Undertake and contribute to health research projects of varying complexity applying appropriate quantitative and/or qualitative research methods (e.g., literature reviews, interviews, surveys, and statistical models)
   Produce high quality, well written research reports, data analysis plans, executive summaries, blogs, data visualizations, and proposals
   Interpret data results with ease and clarity into key messages and visualizations for a range of audiences
   Plan and write grant proposals – this includes but is not limited to budget planning, literature review, administrative grant tasks, collaborator meetings, updates, or requests for specific feedback
   Plan budget for individual projects and programs of research – reviewing current budgets and estimating the required funds overtime
   Maintain up-to-date administrative records of institutional research ethics and ICES privacy documentation for each ongoing and completed project
   Support team cohesion and growth, which includes providing mentorship to team members to improve their skills, knowledge, independence, confidence, and/or provide experience in a new area
   Manage the project – this may include both leading projects and coaching other project leads (e.g., collaborating clinical expert, junior team member, student, etc.) in planning a project (typically a manuscript within a series of projects) and helping ensure each step is executed according to timelines, budget, and research standards
   Communicate effectively with team members, clinical collaborators, colleagues, research advisors, patient partners, and external stakeholders
   Provide logistical support for research-related tasks – this may include scheduling, hosting, attending regular meetings, as well as ongoing administrative and collaborator correspondence
   Communicate and coordinate with Research Institutes’ Finance and HR teams as it pertains to team management (namely for budgeting, staff hiring, and onboarding)
   Develop and maintain systems to track progress of research projects and stakeholder outreach
   Additional duties may be added as projects progress
 
  Required Qualifications and competencies
 
   Graduate degree (MSc or PhD) in biostatistics, epidemiology, or equivalent
   Minimum four (4) years’ experience in clinical or health services research, including leading or managing multi-year studies
   Demonstrated training and experience in quantitative study design and methodology 
  Experience in study or project management in an academic research environment 
  Experience with peer-mentorship or mentorship of research students and/or staff 
  Exceptional writing skills and ability to communicate effectively across a variety of audiences
   Proven expertise leading research studies (e.g., peer-reviewed publications or other research products)
   Demonstrated expertise with advanced data analysis techniques
   Knowledge of computer software packages including Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint
   Ability to work independently and collaboratively
   Strong organizational and interpersonal skills
   Ability to set priorities, deliver high quality products and meet deadlines
   Excellent communication skills, written and oral, in English
   Fluent in French and English, an asset
 
  Preferred Competencies
 
   Experience with ICES data, either internally (analyst or student) or as collaborating researcher or research staff
   Experience writing grants and peer-reviewed publications
   Experience in designing studies, conducting statistical analyses (i.e., R-Programming, SAS, STATA, etc.) and interpreting the results
   Proactive approach to study planning, with an understanding of the research lifecycle for both health services and clinical research projects
   Experience in the following areas is an asset: predictive modelling, systematic reviews, clinical decision-making, older adult populations, end-of-life or long-term care research
 
 
   If you are interested in this opportunity, please submit your cover letter and resume to
 
 
   BRI-HR@bruyere.org
 
 
   Attention Human Resources with subject line “Research Associate I – Dr. Kobewka”,
 
 
   no later than October 6, 2023.
 
 
   Please note that incomplete applications may not be reviewed.
